intro: Cyrtandra pilostila, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cyrtandra pilostila is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in the understory of native forests.
